alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:41AM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR MCDONALD AND SOUTHWESTERN BARRY COUNTIES... At 139 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Grove to near Maysville to near West Siloam Springs, moving northeast at 50 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR MCDONALD AND SOUTHWESTERN BARRY COUNTIES! HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Significant wind damage has been reported from the Tulsa metropolitan area northeast to near the Missouri and Oklahoma state line. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. These severe storms will be near... Noel around 150 AM CDT. Lanagan around 155 AM CDT. Pineville and Anderson around 200 AM CDT. Goodman around 205 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Big Sugar Creek State Park, Roaring River State Park, Dodge, Butterfield, Cayuga, Wayne, Powell, Tiff City, Rocky Comfort and Ridgley. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 14. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across northeastern Oklahoma. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
